New Records: Framber Valdez flirted with a no-hitter for the second time this season, coming within one out of a no-hitter on Aug. 6 at Texas.
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve hit a game-winning double in the bottom of the 9th inning to score Jake Meyers and send the Astros to a 3-2 walk-off win over the Royals.
Paul DeJong tied the game with a two-run homer in the top of the 9th off Houston closer Josh Hader.
Bryan Abreu gave up a two-out single to pinch-hitter Kyle Isbel in the 8th inning to break up the no-hit bid.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Joe Espada emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Joe Espada praised Framber Valdez's performance, saying 'he's just really, really good.'
Jose Altuve expressed gratitude for the opportunity to score the winning run.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros have had five no-hit bids of at least seven innings this year, which ties the 1989 Rangers and 1965 Reds for the most in one season in the expansion era (since 1961).
Framber Valdez relied heavily on his sinker (41 pitches) and curveball (37 pitches) to keep the Royals' all-righty lineup off balance.
Others: The game was a dramatic, 3-2, walk-off win for the Astros.
The Astros have won three games in a row.
